intro: Dichrocephala erecta, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides. Dichrocephala erecta is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
